skill.name: docs-write
skill.description: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when creating or editing documentation files (markdown, MDX, etc.).
skill.summary: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when cre...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only writing guidance and formatting rules. No code execution, network access, or sensitive file access is present.

content.value_statement: Documentation can feel wordy and unclear. This skill gives a direct style guide and concrete patterns for headings, tone, and formatting.
actual_capabilities: Sets a conversational, user-focused tone for docs
Defines heading patterns that state the main point
Specifies formatting rules for code and UI labels
Provides do and do not language choices
limitations: Does not run formatting tools automatically
Does not validate command outputs or examples
Does not generate diagrams or images
Does not integrate with external documentation systems

use_cases.title: Rewrite a guide
use_cases.description: Convert a draft into Metabase style with clear headings and direct steps.

use_cases.title: Ship release notes
use_cases.description: Create concise, user-focused release notes without jargon.

use_cases.title: Improve help articles
use_cases.description: Clarify troubleshooting steps and match tone to the audience.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner rewrite
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this section in Metabase documentation style and keep it short and direct.

prompt_templates.title: Heading audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite these headings so they state the point and use sentence case.

prompt_templates.title: Formatting pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix formatting so code uses backticks and UI elements use bold text.

prompt_templates.title: Full doc edit
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit this document for tone, structure, and clarity, and list any sections that need missing context.

output_examples.input: Rewrite this setup guide to match Metabase style and add clear headings.
output: Set your environment variables before starting
Run the setup command, then verify the output
Explain why each step matters in one short sentence

best_practices: Lead with the action, then explain why
Use descriptive links instead of here
Keep each paragraph focused on one purpose
anti_patterns: Burying key steps inside long paragraphs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Markdown and MDX?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance applies to Markdown and MDX documentation files.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It provides style guidance only and does not run tools or verify command results.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my docs pipeline?
faq.answer: No. It does not connect to external systems or deploy content.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It only provides writing guidance based on your input.

faq.question: What if the output feels too formal?
faq.answer: Ask for a more conversational tone and shorter sentences.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing help?
faq.answer: It follows Metabase specific style rules and terminology preferences.
